message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. At 20 weeks gestation, the placental edge was 5 cm away from the internal cervical os, indicating a normally lying placenta. At the current visit, the placental edge is only 1 cm from the internal cervical os, indicating marginal previa. All other options do not match the given information.

The initial ultrasound showed a normally lying placenta, but at the current visit, the placental edge is only 1 cm from the internal cervical os, indicating marginal previa. Option (A) is the correct answer as it describes a normally lying placenta initially but then becoming marginal previa. All other options describe a placenta that remains in the same position.
